etymology.description: semantic: 頁(頁) (yè, "head") + phonetic: 令(令) (lǐng) = head related part -> neck, collar
etymology.interpretation: 領(領) (lǐng, "neck, collar") combines 頁(頁) (yè, "head"), indicating a part of the body, with 令(令) (lǐng), which gives the phonetic sound. The character conveys the connection to the head area, specifically the neck or collar.

examples.chinese: 她穿着带有花边领的衬衫(她穿著帶有花邊領的襯衫)。
examples.pinyin: tā chuānzhuó dài yǒu huābiān lǐng de chènshān。
examples.english: She is wearing a blouse with a lace collar.

examples.chinese: 他穿着西装(他穿著西裝)，衬衫的领口很精致(襯衫的領口很精緻)。
examples.pinyin: tā chuānzhuó xīzhuāng, chènshān de lǐngkǒu hěn jīngzhì。
examples.english: He is wearing a suit, and his shirt’s collar is exquisite.

examples.chinese: 老狗的脖子上挂着一个小领(老狗的脖子上掛著一個小領)。
examples.pinyin: lǎo gǒu de bózi shàng guà zhe yí gè xiǎo lǐng。
examples.english: The old dog has a small collar hanging on its neck.
